intro: Triopterys paniculata, commonly known as the Mexican evergreen hibiscus, is a tropical shrub native to Central America and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its broad, glossy, dark green leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and yellow. It thrives in humid, well-drained soils and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Triopterys paniculata is also valued for its ability to tolerate partial shade and its use in traditional medicine.
